intro: Laurembergia tetrandra var. mildbraedii, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare and requires careful cultivation.
